title: Lesson 47
paragraph: This lesson examines authority and control, including dominance, governance, and regulation.

words.example: The dominance of the company affected market prices.

words.meaning: forcing someone to act by threat or pressure
words.example: The confession was obtained under coercion.
The subjugation of the region was complete.

words.meaning: a rule or directive made to control conduct
words.example: The government issued new safety regulations.

words.meaning: the act of compelling observance of a law or rule
words.example: Police are responsible for law enforcement.

words.meaning: close observation, especially of a suspect or area
the action or manner of governing
the capacity to have an effect on others
the official power to make legal decisions
words.example: The case fell under federal jurisdiction.

words.meaning: the state of being the highest in power or authority
words.example: The monarchy asserted its supremacy over the region.
